DataElement.preferredName: Adverse Event Outcome Assessment Observation Performed Study Activity Approach Anatomic Site Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action of evaluating the final state of a subject or study subject who experienced an adverse event, which takes place after the adverse event occurs. A coded value specifying the anatomic location or access point for an observation. EXAMPLE(S): Anus for a colonoscopy observation NOTE(S): (1) Neither target anatomic site nor approach anatomic site is necessarily required or relevant for certain observations, however if either or both are present then the distinction between them is that the approach site is the access point for the measurement or observation and the target site is what is ultimately being evaluated. (2) Anatomic site and laterality both are included in this concept.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Outcome Assessment Observation Performed Study Activity Approach Anatomic Site Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The result of an action.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._A way of entering or leaving.:Named locations of or within the body.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Adverse Event Outcome Assessment Observation Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The result of an action.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Concepts.definition: A way of entering or leaving.
Named locations of or within the body.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
